title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of the mysteriously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl grows up in the racially charged South, with her father defending a black man accused rap.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that employs surveillance and control over its citizens.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A story of manners and marriage among the British gentry, focusing on Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of a young man Holden Caulfield, who leaves his school and ventures into New York City.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a journey with dwarves to reclaim their mountain home from the dragon Smaug.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahabâ€™s obsessive quest to seek revenge on the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel that chronicles the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd dreams of finding treasure in Egypt, embarking on a life-changing journey.

title: Adventures of SherlockHolmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the legendary detective Holmes.
